p: Quercetin ( 76), epigallocatechin gallate ( 77) and gallocatechin gallate ( 78, GCG) also show mild inhibitory effects against SARS-CoV 3CL pro, with IC 50 values of 73 μM, 73 μM and 47 μM, respectively ( Fig. 19 ). In addition, 78 exhibits competitive inhibition towards 3CL pro, with a Ki value of 25 μM. According to the results from a docking analysis, the galloyl acyl moiety at the 3-OH position of compound 78, which occupies the S1 pocket, is essential for inhibitory activity against 3CL pro [ 79]. A series of inhibitors were isolated and purified from the leaves of Torreya nucifera ( Fig. 19). According to a preliminary screen, the biflavone amentoflavone ( 79) (IC 50 = 8.3 μM) exerted the most potent inhibitory effect against 3CL pro. A SAR study based on these flavonoids found that a methoxy substitution at the C-7 position could enhance the inhibitory effect. Specifically, the C-7 methoxy-substituted compounds 80 (IC 50 = 32.0 μM) and 81 (IC 50 = 38.4 μM) exhibited two-fold higher inhibitory activity against SARS-CoV 3CL pro compared with that of 82 (IC 50 = 72.3 μM) [ 80].
